results.title: Dread beat and blood
results.creator_credit: Franco Rosso and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: A unique combination of poetry, music, and politics is portrayed in this film about black reggae musician Lindsay Kwesi Johnson. The lifestyle of blacks in Britain is shown and the pressures they live under. Johnson is seen giving poetry readings in the recording studio as a black activist.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Rosso and Arts Council of Great Britain

results.title: Drawings that walk and talk
results.creator_credit: K H Frank, Marie Seton, British Film Institute and National Film Archive (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: Traces briefly the history of the animated cartoon. Discusses the purpose of caricature giving an animal a man’s mind and behaviour pattern. Includes excerpts from “Drama Among the Puppets” (France 1908), an Otto Herman treatment (Germany pre 1914), and many others from France, England and America. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: K H Frank, Marie Seton, British Film Institute and National Film Archive (Great Britain)

results.title: The Drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci
results.creator_credit: Adrian de Potier, Basil Wright and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Drawings and notes of Leonardo da Vinci from the Royal Collection at Windsor Castle, the Royal Academy and the British Museum with some comment and explanation, to celebrate the quincentenary of Leonardo’s birth. Narrated by Sir Laurence Olivier.

results.title: Drawing with a pencil
results.brief_description: The technique of one of America’s foremost pencil sketchers, Thomas Kautsky, is shown by observing him at work sketching a 17th century cooper’s shop situated between the towns of Rockport and Gloucester, in Massachussetts, USA. The film is designed for use by teachers of art, and will be most useful if previewed by the teacher before use with a class.

results.creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Drama lesson
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the system of ‘creative drama’ being practiced in some Australian schools. The system aims to stimulate the imagination of the children. Encourages children to improvise and recreate situations based on their experiences. Includes a film made by an improvisation and discusses the planning of its action. Drama teacher Jean Stuart and students from Fort Street Girls High School and Vaucluse Boy’s Hight School appear in this documentary.

results.title: Drama is...
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: To promote drama as a method which teachers should have in their armoury of skills. It shows how drama can be integrated into the total curriculum, and how it can be about coming to grips with real problems and about caring, sharing and understanding.

results.title: Il Drama di Cristo
results.creator_credit: Enrico Gras, Luciano Emmer and Colonna Film
results.brief_description: A study of the frescoes of Giotto (1267-1337) in the Sorovegni Chapel, Padua, of four of the most human and dramatic episodes in the life of Christ: the Nativity, the Massacre of the Innocents, Judas’ betrayal and the Crucifixion.

results.brief_description: Traces the history of Australian housing designs from the time of penal settlements to the beginning of this century, and explains why certain styles of housing evolved.

results.title: Dr Spock
results.brief_description: Presents the theories and practice of Dr. Benjamin Spock and his suggestions to parents for dealing with the problems, foibles and characteristics of children from infancy to the age of six.
